page.title: 05Water,High Lorton/Whinlatter
page.content: In this block there are lots of small{streams,}called{becks}or {gills,}including Aiken Beck,Whit Beck and Wythe Gill.They run off the fells and either join together into bigger streams or flow directly into the nearby{River Cocker.}There is a {waterfall}called Spout Force on Aiken Beck which many people visit by walk- ing through the forestry plantation on Whinlatter Pass. The water in the becks is very {clean,}so it goes straight to some houses and farms for their{supply.}It also means that{salmon,trout}and{eels can live in it because they feed on the insects,etc. which breed there.The eels and salmon swim up the River Derwent from the sea at Workington, then into the River Cocker at Cockermouth and finally into the local becks and gills.
